features: Flexible Design: The clever three-in-one design allows for storing, cleaning, and drying makeup brushes. It can be placed on the countertop or hung upside down! Strap it on and gently hang it in the bathroom, allowing it to dry faster. Hanging it upside down also keeps the bristles straighter. It won't wet the countertop either.

High-Quality Silicone: Made from silicone, it can be disinfected with hot water and reused repeatedly. Cleaning is a breeze with just a bit of detergent. The brush pad is suitable for various brushes, including hard-to-clean kabuki brushes. With the hanging strap, you can easily air-dry all your tools. Moreover, the handle is detachable, and the bottom can be placed flat for convenient storage. The sturdy silicone design accommodates and fits various brushes.

Suitable for Various Brushes: The textured surface inside the bowl helps clean the interior of brushes. Most people aren't fond of cleaning their makeup brushes, but this cool device makes the process simple. Just add soap and water to the textured section at the top, and you can clean your makeup brushes here. The makeup brush cleaning bowl is suitable for all types of makeup brushes, including kabuki brushes, foundation brushes, contour brushes, concealer brushes, and eyeshadow brushes.

Simple and Easy to Use: This little pad makes brush cleaning a breeze! The texture of the makeup brush cleaning bowl is excellent, ensuring that the brushes are both clean and beautiful. This well-crafted product is a very practical tool. You can put the cleaning solution on the ball to clean the dirt off the brushes. Then, you can hang it up to let the brushes air dry upside down. It helps keep the brushes organized.

A Gift for Her: This makeup brush cleaning bowl is both elegant and stylish. It makes for a thoughtful gift, whether as a token of appreciation or a birthday present for your significant other, friends, and family. It's a charming and perfect gift for mothers, girlfriends, grandmothers, and friends.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Device for Cleaning Makeup Brushes
reviews.reviewText: I have a set of expensive and well-made makeup brushes that I purchased from Prescriptives over two decades ago. I was taught then to always wash the brushes with regular shampoo (never baby shampoo!) and tepid to warm water and lay them flat on a towel to dry. Prescriptives had a lifetime guarantee to replace the brushes for free, and of course Estee Lauder has now discontinued Prescriptives, so I've tried very diligently to preserve the brushes I have with the greatest of gentle care. I store them between uses upright in an enclosed box and keep them in a cabinet when not in use to ensure no excessive exposure to light. I wanted to try this silicone cleaner because it allows for drying of the brushes to occur with the brush end down, which offers a quicker method of drying than lying them flat. The basket is easy to assemble and use. Just. fill with a capful or two of regular shampoo and then fill the basket with warm water. You can gently swish the brush around in the soapy solution and carefully and lightly scrub against the base of the basket to clean the brush strands and dislodge makeup, etc. I like to rinse the brush several times under warm running water until the water runs clear. It also may be necessary to repeat the washing process in the basket one or two times, depending on how dirty the brushes are with dried foundation or lipstick. Once the brushes are clean, empty the basket and rinse it out, then turn it upside down and place your brushes handle end down into the bottom of the basket. The basket "holes" vary in size to accommodate the smallest brush handle diameter to the largest. Then hang the basket up with the provided hook to drip and air dry. I place a towel underneath to keep the counter dry. Once dry, store your brushes ready and clean for the next use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This brush cleaning bowl makes cleaning my makeup brushes convenient. The interior has a texured silicone for loosening any product left on the brushes. The underside of the bowl has silicone slots to insert your brushes to dry. Even the smallest of my brushes held.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Makes washing brushes much easier
reviews.reviewText: This makeup brush cleaning basket makes an annoying task just a little bit easier. The ridges in the basket help to release the makeup deep in the brushes. Once you’re done washing your brushes you can use the basket to stand them up which dries then a little more efficiently than if you just laid them out on a towel. With this makeup brush cleaning basket, maybe I will actually start washing my brushes appropriately!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Good for Cleaning Brushes but Needs Improvement
reviews.reviewText: I’m not sure why they call this a cleaner machine. It’s not a machine. But it is more efficient to clean my makeup brushes in this bowl than to just wash them by hand. I just add a blob of shampoo and hot water and scrub the brushes on the bottom of the bowl. The textured bottom does a good job of cleaning the bristles. Unfortunately, the light peachy pink color of the bowl stains easily, and I am not able to get the stains out. Because of this, I avoid cleaning my eye makeup brushes in this bowl. I like the idea of sticking the brush handles in the bottom of the bowl to let them air dry. Unfortunately, half of my brush handles are too big to fit in the holes (see picture). The heart hook is cute and a nice touch.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Perfect for cleaning and drying my make up brushes. I love the convenience of being able to use this bucket to was my brushes then hanging them up to dry all with one thing. It’s made very well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wash Your Brushes!
reviews.reviewText: I really like this! I'm using it mostly for washing my paint brushes. I don't use makeup brushes too often. That being said, they should STILL be cleaned! This is perfect for both. You can wash/agitate in the little bowl and hang them upside down after cleaning, flip it back around, and it's storage. Great! I'll be able to use it for so many purposes. I hate when something just sits there waiting to be used a few times a year. But, this is like a blank canvas, just do what you want with it really! I'm trying to figure out how I could even use it for Cricut supplies....

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars My wife likes it
reviews.reviewText: From her:I finally got a chance to clean my brushes. I have to do a lot of stage makeup for the theater so I'm always using different shades. My brushes can get really gross after a few uses but whenever I cleaned them, I never felt like they were getting clean enough. Having this little cleaning bucket had been super helpful. The textured bottoms allow me to really get into the bristles to get the very ends clean. The only reason why I didn't give it 5 stars us because the holes that you can stick your brushes in are too small for some of my fatter brushes

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Keep your makeup brushes clean
reviews.reviewText: I love this makeup brush cleaner machine! It's so easy to use and it cleans my brushes very well. I just put some water and soap in the bowl, attach the brush to the spinner, and press the button. It spins the brush and removes all the dirt and makeup residue. The mat is also very handy for drying the brushes. It has different textures for different types of brushes and it's very soft and gentle. I highly recommend this product to anyone who wants to keep their brushes clean and hygienic.
